metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1907 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The ssh_packet_read_poll2 function in packet.c in OpenSSH before 7.1p2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and application crash) via crafted network traffic.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1907` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:7.1p2-1
openssh-client-ssh1 - 1:7.1p2-1
openssh-server - 1:7.1p2-1
openssh-sftp-server - 1:7.1p2-1
ssh - 1:7.1p2-1
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:7.1p2-1
ssh-krb5 - 1:7.1p2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:7.1p2-1').
